com.io7m.jcanephora.profiler

Class JCGLProfiling

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.io7m.jcanephora.profiler.JCGLProfiling
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    JCGLProfilingType

    public final class JCGLProfiling
extends Object
implements JCGLProfilingType
    The default implementation of the JCGLProfilingType interface.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int frameDelay()
      As polling profiling timers every frame would cause excessive GPU/CPU syncs, profiling implementations will typically lag behind by a given number of frames to avoid causing the driver to synchronize.

      • trimContexts

        public void trimContexts()
        Trim any cached internal storage. This is primarily useful because implementations are expected to reuse a lot of data structures internally (because the graph of renderers and filters being profiled rarely changes).
        Specified by:
        trimContexts in interface JCGLProfilingType

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled()
        Specified by:

        Returns:

      • mostRecentlyMeasuredFrame

        public JCGLProfilingFrameMeasurementType mostRecentlyMeasuredFrame()
        Specified by:
        mostRecentlyMeasuredFrame in interface JCGLProfilingType
        Returns:
        The elapsed time of the most recently measured frame

      • frameDelay

        public int frameDelay()
        Description copied from interface: JCGLProfilingType
        As polling profiling timers every frame would cause excessive GPU/CPU syncs, profiling implementations will typically lag behind by a given number of frames to avoid causing the driver to synchronize. This method returns the number of frames behind that profiling data is lagging.
        Specified by:
        frameDelay in interface JCGLProfilingType
        Returns:
        The number of frames behind that profiling data typically lags
